messages.title: Is your NHS safe?
messages.content: The leaflet discusses the state of the NHS under the current government, with specific examples of closures and the promise of a Labour 10-year plan for the NHS.

messages.title: Local Lib Dems back Tories
messages.content: The message claims that local Liberal Democrats are effectively supporting the Conservatives, citing examples of support for plans and policies.

messages.title: Have your say, register to vote
messages.content: The leaflet urges people to register to vote, providing details on how to do so.

messages.title: Newcastle loses more
messages.content: The message focuses on the financial damage allegedly caused to Newcastle by the Tories.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour promises a 10-year plan for the NHS, aiming to reverse closures and cutbacks.
Labour's commitment to Sure Start centres is emphasized as part of their approach to early education.

issues.economy: The leaflet criticizes the current government for the state of the economy in Newcastle, mentioning financial losses and impact on public services.
issues.education: Mentions Labour's support for Sure Start centres as an investment in children's future and criticizes the Conservatives for letting them down.
issues.governance: Complaints about the Liberal Democrats backing Tory plans.
issues.health: Discussion of Labour's plan to protect the NHS and criticisms of the Tory government's handling of the health service.

housing.content: Relevant information about housing policies is not explicitly stated in the leaflet.

leaflet.personalStatement: The leaflet contains statements and endorsements for the candidate Vale but no specific personal statement is provided.

images.caption: Labour Party group photo with the caption 'Newcastle Labour Party Working together for our city'

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet is Issue 17 of 'Dene Voice' and urges constituents to get in touch with their Labour team, citing opposition to the Tories and local issues.
